body.name: USB-C HUB, DockteckExpand USB C to USB Adapter (5 in 1) with 4K HDMI, 100W Power Delivery, 5Gbps USB-C Data Port & 2 5Gbps USB-A Data Ports for MacBook Pro/Air, iPad Pro/Air, Dell XPS and More

features: 5-IN-1 USB C HUB: Equipped with 1 x 4K@30Hz HDMI, 1 x 100W PD charging port, 1 x 5Gbps USB-C data port and 2 x USB 3.0. Plug-and-play, perfect for devices with limited ports

USB C HDMI 4K@30Hz: This USB C Hub Multi-Port Adapter supports Mirror Mode or Extended Mode to connect your device to a larger display or projector using the HDMI port. Enjoy crisp visuals in movies, presentations or games

SEAMLESS 5Gbps DATA TRANSFER: 1 USB-C data port and 2 USB 3.0 ports ensure smooth, efficient data transfer between USB-C devices. Easily transfer files, synchronize data and connect external storage devices
100W PD EFFICIENT FAST CHARGING: The included PD charging port lets you quickly charge USB-C devices. Keep your laptop, iPad, or steam deck powered up so you can work while charging

WIDE DEVICE COMPATIBILITY: This 5 in 1 USB C Dongle is compatible with a wide range of devices that support Type-C connectivity, such as laptops, tablets, and smartphones. It works seamlessly with popular devices such as MacBook Pro, Chromebook and iPad Pro
body.description: DockteckExpand 5 in 1 USB C to USB Adapter Plug and Play, No Software, Drivers required The USB-C hub is equipped with a dedicated chip for each port to ensure a stable and reliable interfaceIt has been tested to withstand more than 10,000 unplugging cycles, proving its ruggednessThe durability of the hub is due to the use of precision instruments to solder the chipsIn addition, its aluminum casing helps dissipate heat quickly and provides protection for the deviceDespite its compact size, this hub is a powerful performer 1x USB C to HDMI: up to 4K@30Hz 1x USB-C PD Port: up to 100W USB-C Data Port: up to 5120Mbps 2x USB 3.0 A Ports: up to 5 Gbps

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Why DockteckExpand Usb Hub Each port has a built-in chip, no driver requiredMetal shield inside and heat sink enclosure outsideCompact and Portable, all work items are concentrated in a small product DockteckExpand 5 in 1 USB C to USB Adapter Plug and Play, No Software, Drivers required The USB-C hub is equipped with a dedicated chip for each port to ensure a stable and reliable interfaceIt has been tested to withstand more than 10,000 unplugging cycles, proving its ruggednessThe durability of the hub is due to the use of precision instruments to solder the chipsIn addition, its aluminum casing helps dissipate heat quickly and provides protection for the deviceDespite its compact size, this hub is a powerful performer 1x USB C to HDMI: up to 4K@30Hz 1x USB-C PD Port: up to 100W USB-C Data Port: up to 5120Mbps 2x USB 3.0 A Ports: up to 5 Gbps

Ultra-fast charging The 100W PD port provides continuous charging (up to 92W) for your MacBook or iPad Pro, so you'll never have to worry about losing power again Seamless 5Gbps data transfer With transfer rates of up to 5120Mbps on 1 USB-C port and 5Gbps on 2 USB3.0-A ports, you can transfer data in seconds Ideal for multiple USB peripherals 2 USB ports are ideal for your needs, so you can connect a mouse, keyboard, webcam, printer and more

Ideal for Play Game The convenient Steam Deck gaming dock provides a convenient connection and charging solution that optimizes the gaming experience for gamers 4K External Display It can be used with a monitor/HDTV/projector running at 4K@30Hz, perfect for meetings and presentations Compact and lightweight The lightweight and portable design is perfect for traveling, allowing you to take it with you wherever you go

For iPad iPad Pro M1 2021 / 2020 / 2019 / 2018, iPad Air 4 / 2022 / 2020 / 2018, iPad Mini 6, iMac M1 2021 / 2018 / 2017 / iMac Pro / Mac Mini M1 2018 For Samsung Samsung Galaxy S22 / S22 Ultra / S21 / S20 / S20 Plus / S20 Ultra / S10 / S10 + / S10E / S9 / S9 + / S8 / S8 + / Note 10+ / Note 10 / Note 9 / Note 8, Tab S4 / S5e / S6 / S7 ( Support Samsung Dex Mode ) For Microsoft Microsoft Surface Studio / Surface Book 3 / Surface Book 2 / Surface Go / Surface Pro 8 / Surface Pro 7 / Surface Pro X / Surface Laptop 3 / Microsoft Lumia 950 with Thunderbolt 3 / 4 For MacBook MacBook Pro M1 2021 / 2020 / 2019 / 2018 / 2017 / 2016, Apple MacBook Air M1 2021 / 2020 / 2019 / 2018, more New MacBook with Thunderbolt 4 / 3 For HP HP EliteBook Folio G1 / Spetre 13 x360 / Zbook (Studio) / Zbook Studio x360, Probook 430 G6, ChromeBook x2, Envy 13 x360 2018/2019 Supported systems Steam Deck, Windows 10, 8, 7, Vista, XP, Mac OS X 10.6 or later, Linux 2.6.14 or Later For Lenovo Yoga 920 / 910 / 900, Yoga 4 Pro, Thinkpad X1 Carbon 2019 / 2018 / 2017 Incompatible devices Nintendo Switch, USB SuperDrive For Google Pixelbook 2019 / 2018 / 2017

Before purchase please Note Our DockteckExpand 5 in 1 USB Dock ONLY works with host device with USB-C ports for DP alt-mode video output, data transfer and charging 4K 30Hz HDMI Port: To get 4K@ 30Hz, please ensure that both the connected device and display are the same resolution as well as the HDMI cable USB 3.0 ports: The 2 × USB-A ports on this steam deck hub usb c are mainly intended for data transfer and do not support high charging power (in particular, you should not charge your tablet) USB-C 100W PD port: Since the hub itself will consume 8W during charging, to ensure the normal performance of the device and hub, please use the charger that has a wattage higher than 45W and supports PD fast charging protocol; The actual power delivery output depends on the charger and cable used

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s worth it for the price
reviews.reviewText: For the extremely reasonable price, I recommend this product. I receive a weak charger notice from my dell due to it not being powerful enough but it’s a work laptop so that doesn’t concern me much.For what it’s designed to do, it does its job. It connects my extra monitor to my laptop and charges my laptop even with the weak charge notification.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I primarily use this to connect my USB webcam to my MacBook. I chose this one specifically because it has a power delivery port, allowing me to plug it into the charging port. This setup allows me to connect my second monitor cable to the second USB-C port and also plug in my charger cable, USB webcam, and occasionally my USB microphone into this hub. As a bonus, it even comes with a carrying pouch for when it's not in use! Overall, I'm quite happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I need

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great on MacBook Pro
reviews.reviewText: We buy a lot of these for our IT department. We issue one with every macbook pro we give to a staff member.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Laptop is nice and light, but what about when it's at your desk and you want to use accessories...
reviews.reviewText: Between the work DELL with it's 3 usb and my MAC M2 Air, it can be frustrating trying to plug everything in. Work from home 3 days a week, have a small desk that is dominated with a 34" WIDE monitor so it takes up most the space. Don't want a big 'docking station', waste of the space I have left. I can plug this 'mini-dock' into the DELL when working, and into the MAC on the weekends. This gives me everything to connect a wired keyboard and mouse, monitor and ethernet, and a Timemachine drive on the MAC. Then I connected a USB 3 hub to it and now I have plenty of expand-ability for my wireless headset and to use with USB sticks. And if I travel, just throw it in the bag and i get the ports I need without taking up much space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this docking station to be able to work from home with my laptop and monitors. It was pretty straightforward and easy to set up. It is nice because it doesn't take up too much room. Great price and would reccomened to anyone looking for a good docking station.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very useful gadget for new laptops
reviews.reviewText: The newest 13" laptop I recently bought only has 2 USB-C ports and nothing else. One port is needed for charging, and the other is not really enough to hook up anything. Also, I have hard drives, mouse and other peripherals that still use USB-3.0 ports. This multiport expander lets me hook up all those without a problem, and lets me charge through it as well, which frees up the second USB-C port. It also provides an HDMI video port, in case you need one. The price is also very good. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Swiss Army Knife of Multiport Adapter
reviews.reviewText: This adapter replaces a number of individual adaptors and is better built than most of the ones it replaces. The bag is a nice addition to keep the dust out when not in use. I use it on an LG Gram, running Windows 11, and it keeps a second USB C port free. Not sure I will ever use the HDMI port but it is nice to have.

Am using this Hub on my Dell XPS 13. Runs perfectly on all ports (including the ethernet). Very high quality item with a very professional feel and look - was not expecting that so very happy. Recommended product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent USB-C hub / docking station for travel -- won't be my choice for everyday use
reviews.reviewText: I bought this USB-C hub to allow me to quickly connect my laptop to a monitor, keyboard, and mouse. With 1 HDMI port, 2 USB-A ports (USB 3.0), 1 USB-C port (100W PD), an SD card slot, a MicroSD card slot, and a 1 Gbps Ethernet port, this packs a lot into a small form factor.While I didn't have a 4K monitor to test, I tested both mirroring and extending my desktop onto a 1080p monitor, and both worked fine. Windows 11 reported the refresh rate at 60 Hz, as indicated in the product description.I tested the wired Ethernet and it negotiated successfully at 1 Gbps, as shown in my photos.Overall, this will be fine for travel, but it certainly doesn't replace a more expensive docking station given the short length of the USB-C cable and the fact that it only has two USB-A ports. However, putting things into perspective, an "official" docking station made by my laptop's manufacturer is over $500. Although I still find this device a bit pricey for what you get, it suddenly doesn't seem so expensive when you think of it that way.What's in the Box□ USB-C hub□ Carrying case□ User manualThings I Like✓ Plug-and-play. As soon as I plugged it in, I was able to use my connected USB peripherals, and the monitor and Ethernet connected just fine.✓ Compact, meaning it will be handy to keep in my laptop bag for travelling✓ I may not be in the majority, but as an IT professional, I prefer the speed and stability of wired Ethernet connections, so I appreciate that this device has an Ethernet port✓ The box lists RoHS and FCC markings (but no FCC ID), while the product itself bears the CE and FCC markings (but no RoHS marking). It's hard to know if these are genuine, but I like to see themAreas for Improvement✗The USB-C cable connecting the device to your laptop is really short. It would be nice to have a longer cable (or a detachable cable, so that I can use whatever length of USB-C cable I like)✗I'd personally prefer more USB-A ports in lieu of the SD / MicroSD card slots. Two USB-A ports won't go far, particularly if you've got a wired keyboard and mouse✗ The product photos on this listing show a braided cable. The product I received does not have a braided cable, which would be nice to have for extra protection against breakage✗The carrying case is pointless and just adds waste
